body: @wu-sheng From the last discussion, we should support both push and pull modes. So I push Prometheus format parser into the `core` module to share it between Fetcher and Receiver.

I would like to say, creating a new maven module, called such as prometheus-meter-adaptor separately. Because we clearly don't depend on Prometheus in the core level. And this library has a chance to be reused by 3rd party, even maybr we are not sure whether or who want to use. WDYT?

This module could be provided as a submodule of `server-library` as it is very independent. The MeterSystem(in core), fetcher, and receiver should be linked through this library through DI(Dependency Injection) mode.

Also, I am wondering, where you plan to put the convention codes? I think those are very close to Prometheus codebase too, right?

FYI @mrproliu I think you should follow this, take part in. And could consider how the micrometer system and our native metrics procotol/API work. We could begin on that part too since @hanahmily is beginning to process Prometheus part.

> FYI @mrproliu I think you should follow this, take part in. And could consider how the micrometer system and our native metrics procotol/API work. We could begin on that part too since @hanahmily is beginning to process Prometheus part.

I have starting to watch this PR, should we have a little discussion with the native protocol, pull/push model, and micrometer with the meter system? I seem currently of code, most are analyzing the Prometheus protocol data.

> I have starting to watch this PR, should we have a little discussion with the native protocol, pull/push model, and micrometer with the meter system? I seem currently of code, most are analyzing the Prometheus protocol data.

Yes, once you have some proposals, I and @hanahmily could set a zoom meeting and talk directly.
We could record the discussion and share to the community.

Could you provide detail about which API(s) you are planning to use for watching the config?

spring-cloud uses two modes to watch configmap changes: Polling, and Event. That's because it uses Watcher API which can disconnect (network problems, timeout, etc). So if users want to avoid them, Polling strategy is the option.

My suggestion is we should adopt to Informer which tries to re-list and re-watch to hide such failures from the caller. Below is the example
https://github.com/kubernetes-client/java/blob/master/examples/src/main/java/io/kubernetes/client/examples/InformerExample.java
